runs.comm: oops, that's fast, furious and misdirected ... Rusty?
fast again, and off target again. Sibanda wafts but doesn't come close, and the umpire signals another wide
short and tucked off the hips. A slight misfield at square leg gives Sibanda notions of a single, but he thinks better of it
that's much better - short, angry and quick. Sibanda does well to lift his gloves well out of the way. He's furious ... with himself and everything around him
full and pushed into the covers, a direct hit would have been close, but Hussey misses. It's all happening out there
pushed back onto the stumps, but Taylor gets off the mark with an angled steer to gully
short, a thick edge and a genuine chance, but that flew clean through the vacant third slip and all the way to the boundary.
drawn forward in a watchful defence
hint of swing? Left alone at any rate
good line, threatening to nip back into the right-hander's off stump. Left again
drawn forward and that's some positive intent from Taylor - a nudge into the covers and an instant call. He's had a great game with the gloves, so his confidence is up
down the pitch and that's a big swing from Sibanda. He doesn't connect, but the positive intent has to be encouraged
fuller and straighter from Bracken, but more good calling results in another important single. Plenty for Ponting to ponder as he adjusts the field
lovely strike! Down on one knee and a full flourish of the bat. The outfield is still sluggish but that was sweetly timed - and placed - and trickles across the rope. Well played
fast and furious again. But only one slip for Lee
Taylor backs away to give himself room. Can't time the backfoot steer, but another single as slip rushes up to field
into position for the pull shot - can't quite time it, but it's good enough to beat midwicket. Aggressive running brings two, and Zimbabwe are calling the shots
that's a fantastic strike - fast, too full, and Sibanda gives himself room to free his arms, and carves Lee clean through the covers
crash! A second boundary in the over, and that's even sweeter than the first. Whistles through point and all the way to the rope
a better delivery to finish, but Australia are suddenly in a bit of strife
down the pitch and clobbered over the top. Fantastic intent from these two batsmen. The ball plugs in the outfield, but no matter. The momentum is with them
fuller length and that's dabbed behind point for a single. Clever, sensible play, from Taylor, who's keeping a cool head while Australia lose theirs
blam! That flew straight back over Bracken's head with a stand-and-deliver swing of the blade! Decapitation was an option there. What on earth is going on?
outside off and swinging away. A better length, but safely negotiated

in the slot for a swing, but Sibanda's gone this time! A bit of lift and away-movement, and Gilchrist behind the stumps takes a comfortable catch. Still, Sibanda has done his bit. He's given his team the start they needed ...
full length, bending back into the right-hander, defended into the covers to complete the over
right on the spot, but Taylor defends into the gap and that's another single
a touch too straight, and Chibhabha nurdles down to fine leg. The scoreboard keeps ticking
dabbed out to the covers and a direct hit would have been close. Instead it's a fumble. Australia aren't yet as sharp in the field as Zimbabwe were
short and left well alone as Gilchrist takes the ball at shoulder-height
a swing and a miss. A few dot-balls creeping in now. Zimbabwe need to keep the strike rotating. Or at least keep their cool if it doesn't
that's a quality strike - straight down the ground with the highest of elbows. It wouldn't have looked out of place in a Test match. Which is how Australia are going to have to play this now ...
On the spot first ball, and pushed into the gap in the covers
driven hard, but this time straight to short cover
misdirected - short and a long-hop to boot. Chibhabha glances expertly to beat the man on the 45, and that's another boundary
whoosh - that had intent, but it was rather a windy woof, as Richie Benaud once put it. Easy now ...
or not! This time he makes contact, and some! The ball was pitched up and right in the slot, and Chibhabha made no mistake whatsoever. Clean as a whistle over long-off!
a dot ball to finish, but that's an expensive start. And Zimbabwe are inching ever closer to a monstrous upset
on the spot, but without much nip, and Taylor has all the time in the world to dab that down to third man. Another run is notched off the requirement
fuller, and angling into off stump, but another single thanks to some sharp calling. They don't have to do much more than that
the momentum is all red and black. That's too short from Clark, and Taylor uses the pace to cut that into the gap behind point. Cool as you like
another single. Superb running between these two, and Ricky Ponting is feeling a little lost
short, and Chibhabha ducks. The crowd bays for a wide, but Clark gets away with it. Only just mind.

that's a massive steepler - it's gone straight up in the air and almost tops out above the Newlands lights. Any man on the field could have claimed it, but Gilchrist with the gloves steps forward, and is a very relieved man to end that mini-onslaught
lovely ball, good lift and carry. Taibu does well not to edge that
another ripper. Welcome to the crease, Tatenda
wide of off stump, but not called. Taibu looks askance at the umpire
this time it is called and rightly so. Another one to the tally
tighter to off stump and good lift off the pitch. Taibu shoulders arms, because he doesn't need to rush this
wide of the off stump again, and that's another marginal call

no width at all this time. That was a perfect lifter on middle stump and seaming away to boot. Taibu feathers a limp defensive stroke to the keeper, and Australia are starting to assert themselves at last.
nudged into the gap. A lot rests on Taylor now
defended into the covers, and the rain gets heavier
nurdled down to fine leg
a bit of a waft outside off, but no edge
slashed and slashed hard, but not the same pace on the ball as before, and third man fields
defended to complete the over, and Zimbabwe slip two runs behind on D/L ...
driven with an open face and third man thinks he's in with a chance for a moment. In the end it bounces just short
short but arrow-straight. Matsikenyeri attempts to cut, but misses
a crazy moment! Matsikenyeri could have been run out at both ends, but two shies both miss, and overthrows are the result! Gosh
that's a massive boundary for Zimbabwe. Short, and Taylor made room to slap a short ball through the gap at point
driven square off the back foot, doesn't quite time it, but that's one more run to take Zimbabwe level on D/L. It couldn't get much more exciting
late cut poked wide of first slip - Ponting's flashing hand, and dive, stopping that. Tight work
back-foot drive, terrible misfield from the usually excellent Symonds who fluffs at cover, the ball heading through his legs. Overthrow results
backing away and away and eventually presses forward in defence - could have waited and turned to leg but it wasn't to be
Matsikenyeri backed away this time and swished at it on the back foot - the ball sailing over the stumps
goes to hook, a huge top-edge goes high and back down into Gilchrist's hands - the keeper didn't have to do too much there, just hold on
driven to mid-off for a quick single
forgettable - dragged it down and the batsman doesn't time the pull properly
defended on the back foot and worked down past first slip
guided easily to midwicket
worked into the covers
tight on off, stands tall, and works the ball into short midwicket
played off the back foot to mid-on
looped up there, a forthright drive eased to Hayden at long-off
pace right off the ball, on a good length, and defended forward
how international cricket has missed Gilchrist's "Aw, yes, mates" but he makes up for them there with one as that's on the spot and defended
another good delivery, defended forward
another dot ball for Hodge
dragged a touch short and the pressure bursts instantly with a cut away behind point off the back foot
oops. short ball invited the hook - and Clark hardly went for it; a dive forward at fine leg and he could have been on to that. He possibly didn't pick it up
worked off the legs
flicked away to deep square for a single
up there, on off, driven back to the bowler who picks it up easily
short and forcefully pulled through square for a one-bounce four
full toss, on leg, awkward height - keeping low - and rushed off the legs to the man at deep square
knocked to mid-on for an easy single
big six - straight down the ground. Taylor comes down the track and plants right over long-off
driven to mid-on
driven out to mid-off for a quick single
full, on off, driven back out to mid-on for a safe single
terrible full toss to bring up the hundred in fine style - booming srtaight drive over long-on. Very well connected

down the track and gets back as Johnson takes the sticks. A tight one, but incredibly Australia do not refer it. Replays look like he was out - possible shocker there. No appeal - and that was too close not to refer
played into the covers
brings his bat down on that one late to knock it into the covers for a quick single
pushed across the righthander and worked down to third man
width outside off; huge outside edge from an attempted cover drive lands safe - and that runs away
worked into the leg, tight, and they look for a quick single, but decide not to
well bowled, low and in on off-stick, driven back out to cover
full toss, thigh height, driven out in front of short midwicket for an easy one
sensible single there - Taylor pushing to cover and setting off immediately to bring up an excellent fifty
pushed on to the back foot and two fielders bound in from the off-side ring to tidy up
on off, driven out to mid-off for a quick single - which becomes two as there's an overthrow from Clark's mis-shy at the non-striker's stumps
full on leg, and well dug out to midwicket for a quick single
full toss slants across the right hander, who drives back to cover where it's well stopped
on off, firmly struck straight towards long-off for one. A two would have been too risky, there
another full toss, driven through extra cover this time and they took the throw on from Hussey - a good decision because they were back easily
driven strongly back to Bracken who is vigilant in tidying up
steps back to give himself room and drives back to Bracken again
full again, driven down the ground towards long-on
yorker, well bowled, but poor fielding as Zimbabwe scramble a single a metre or so square of the wicket as the ball crashes off the bat into the pad and back out there
another yorker, dug out again, with a drive towards the cover boundary
dangerous shot - sounded like an edge but there wasn't - Masakadza trying the sweep and paying for it. You don't get plumber and that wasn't a tough decision
stuns the ball down right onto the batting crease and they run through a very quick single, Lee running soen and breaking the stumps with his hand, not the ball
worked behind square for two
eases back into his crease, but Lee's fired that one in full once more, and then driven out to extra cover where it's well marshalled on the boundary by the sweeper
low full toss outside off, Taylor reaches out to somehow sweep behind square, eluding the man on the way
drive to cover for a single
driven strongly out to long-on and they come back for two runs which were comfortable enough in the end
down the track and he nearly falls over in the effort - a single results and Taylor's back on strike

and that's it! A remarkable victory for Zimbabwe, as that's turned finely through fine leg and races away eluding a diving Clark at full stretch on the rope - but he's beaten and so are Australia. Astonishing.
